At what point is it too many social media accounts to have? 

If new ones rolls out, are you the first to join em and how active can you really be on all of are you dropping one?

Too many politicians mistake good optics for good leadership. They measure success by headlines, polls, and social media hype instead of outcomes. 

PR feels safer. It avoids risk. It keeps everyone smiling, at least for a news cycle. 

But governing isn‚Äôt theater. It‚Äôs decision-making under pressure, often when no option looks good at first glance.

Weaker politicians confuse explanation with permission. They wait to see how something will play before acting, and by then the moment has passed. 

Leadership works the opposite way. You act based on principle, evidence, and responsibility. Then you explain. Clearly. Honestly. In language people can understand.

The public doesn‚Äôt need perfection or spin. It needs coherence. Do the right thing, accept the consequences, and communicate like an adult. 

That‚Äôs not bad PR. 
That‚Äôs leadership.
